title.rendered: Fantasy Cricket Tips for Australia vs England 3rd T20I

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Pitch Report for Australia vs England 3rd T20I

(Based on last 3 games)

1st innings average score:153

2nd innings average score: 148

Type: Decent batting wicket. Bigger square boundaries.

Time: October 14, 1.40 PM IST

Probable Playing XI for Australia & England

Probable XI for Australia: David Warner, Aaron Finch (c), Mitchell Marsh, Glenn Maxwell, Marcus Stoinis, Tim David, Matthew Wade (wk), Pat Cummins, Mitchell Starc, Adam Zampa, Josh Hazlewood

Probable XI for England: Jos Buttler (c & wk), Alex Hales, Dawid Malan, Ben Stokes, Harry Brook, Moeen Ali, Sam Curran, David Willey, Adil Rashid, Reece Topley, Mark Wood

Form Concerns

For five consecutive T20Is, Glenn Maxwell has been dismissed for a single-digit score. The wickets column has gone dry as well.

Ben Stokes doesn’t boast of a great record against Australia in the format. He has collected 22 runs in 4 outings.

Also Read:

T20 World Cup Winners list

Kardinia Park Pitch Report

Game Changers

Talk about chasing a total in T20Is since October 2021, Matthew Wade has been dismissed only once. His scores read 15*, 41*, 26*, 45*, 39*, 21, and 10*.

Sam Curran might have added only 27 runs in his last three innings, but he has made amends by consistently striking in the middle overs. He has 10 wickets in his last 5 T20Is.

Smart Picks

While accumulating 300 runs at 27 in his last 8 T20Is, Alex Hales has also provided a bunch of bonus points for his boundary hitting.

Amidst two ducks, Tim David has slammed one fifty and two scores of 40 in his last 5 T20Is. For maintaining a strike rate of 172 in the previous match, he also generated useful bonus points.

While Pat Cummins has taken 3 wickets in the series, Mitchell Starc bagged a four-wicket haul at Brisbane. Collectively, they have picked 17 wickets in their last 5 T20Is.

Power Players

By smashing 82 off only 49 balls (7 fours and 4 sixes), Dawid Malan finished with the highest fantasy points for the second game on My11Circle.

Marcus Stoinis stormed into the Ultimate Team for finishing with a three-wicket haul at Canberra. Moreover, he also added bonus points for a 13-ball 22 cameo, which came at a strike rate of 169.

Fantasy Tip of The Day

While England’s top order has been delivering consistently, Australia has been erratic. The pacers from both sides have been brilliant.

Ready with your team, play fantasy cricket on My11Circle now!

1 / 5 ( 3 votes )
